pullRequest.title: [RW-4825][risk = no] prerequisites for egress alert enhancements
pullRequest.bodyText:
Make the WorkspaceAdminController functions I need available as a service.
Fix up some tests. A couple of controller tests became trivial after moving the method to the service level. One or two was moved, and a couple more deleted.
Moved to throw NotFoundException (to be converted by the Spring controller code into a 404) rather than manually returning a status with a 404.
Extracted from original PR at #3482

PR checklist

 This PR meets the Acceptance Criteria in the JIRA story
 The JIRA story has been moved to Dev Review
 This PR includes appropriate unit tests
 I have run and tested this change locally
 I have run the E2E tests on ths change against my local UI + API server with yarn test-local
 If this includes a UI change, I have taken screen recordings or screenshots of the new behavior and notified the PO and UX designer
 If this includes an API change, I have updated the appropriate Swagger definitions and notified API consumers
 If this includes a new feature flag, I have created and linked new JIRA tickets to (a) turn on the feature flag and (b) remove it later

nodes.bodyText: Arguably I could split this one out, since it's not needed here, but for simplicity I went one class or file at a time.
I'd build this into a mapper, but it's slated to be removed soon.
We should probably make a separate ProfileService interface and make this a ProfileServiceImpl.
All this updateXForUser should be unchanged from what it was in the ProfileController.
The rename here is because I felt like "federated" wan't really an abstraction, but a function of where the information is fetched from, which is an implementation detail.
@als364 Some things have moved from here.
one could argue that the WorkspaceAdminController should depend on the ActionAuditQueryService directly instead of putting getAuditLogEntries() here.
I killed these two, because it boiled down to m = mock(); assert(m); after the method moved.
@als364 FYI. I'm not sure if there are unit tests covering this page yet, but I made it compile.
N.B. the UserRole object's email is really a username.
Please delete the original ProfileController.updateBypass() because it will be very confusing to have both, even for a short time.
please rm the original ProfileController.FROM_CLIENT_INSTITUTIONAL_AFFILIATION and copy over its comment
